common.availability_description: Defines a template to get the `available` state of the entity. If the template either fails to render or returns `True`, `"1"`, `"true"`, `"yes"`, `"on"`, `"enable"`, or a non-zero number, the entity will be `available`. If the template returns any other value, the entity will be `unavailable`. If not configured, the entity will always be `available`. Note that the string comparison is not case sensitive; `"TrUe"` and `"yEs"` are allowed.
common.attributes_description: Supplementary attributes templates for this entity
common.device_id_description: Select a device to link to this entity.

data_description.value_template: Defines a template to set the state of the alarm panel. Valid output values from the template are `armed_away`, `armed_home`, `armed_night`, `armed_vacation`, `arming`, `disarmed`, `pending`, and `triggered`.
data_description.disarm: Defines actions to run when the alarm control panel is disarmed. Receives variable `code`.
data_description.arm_away: Defines actions to run when the alarm control panel is armed to `arm_away`. Receives variable `code`.
data_description.arm_custom_bypass: Defines actions to run when the alarm control panel is armed to `arm_custom_bypass`. Receives variable `code`.
data_description.arm_home: Defines actions to run when the alarm control panel is armed to `arm_home`. Receives variable `code`.
data_description.arm_night: Defines actions to run when the alarm control panel is armed to `arm_night`. Receives variable `code`.
data_description.arm_vacation: Defines actions to run when the alarm control panel is armed to `arm_vacation`. Receives variable `code`.
data_description.trigger: Defines actions to run when the alarm control panel is triggered. Receives variable `code`.
data_description.code_arm_required: If true, the code is required to arm the alarm.
data_description.code_format: One of `number`, `text` or `no_code`. Format for the code used to arm/disarm the alarm.

data_description.state: The sensor is `on` if the template evaluates as `True`, `yes`, `on`, `enable` or a positive number. Any other value will render it as `off`.

data_description.press: Defines actions to run when button is pressed.

data_description.state: Defines a template to get the state of the cover. Valid output values from the template are `open`, `opening`, `closing` and `closed` which are directly mapped to the corresponding states.  If both a state and a position are specified, only `opening` and `closing` are set from the state template.
data_description.open_cover: Defines actions to run when the cover is opened.
data_description.close_cover: Defines actions to run when the cover is closed.
data_description.stop_cover: Defines actions to run when the cover is stopped.
data_description.position: Defines a template to get the position of the cover. Value values are numbers between `0` (`closed`) and `100` (`open`).
data_description.set_cover_position: Defines actions to run when the cover is given a `set_cover_position` command. Receives variable `position`.

data_description.event_type: Defines a template for the type of the event.
data_description.event_types: Defines a template for a list of available event types.

data_description.state: The fan is `on` if the template evaluates as `True`, `yes`, `on`, `enable` or a positive number. Any other value will render it as `off`.
data_description.turn_off: Defines actions to run when the fan is turned off.
data_description.turn_on: Defines actions to run when the fan is turned on. Receives variables `percentage` and/or `preset_mode`.
data_description.percentage: Defines a template to get the speed percentage of the fan.
data_description.set_percentage: Defines actions to run when the fan is given a speed percentage command.  Receives variable `percentage`.
data_description.speed_count: The number of speeds the fan supports. Used to calculate the percentage step for the `fan.increase_speed` and `fan.decrease_speed` actions.

data_description.url: Defines a template to get the URL on which the image is served.
data_description.verify_ssl: Enable or disable SSL certificate verification. Disable to use an http URL, or if you have a self-signed SSL certificate and haven’t installed the CA certificate to enable verification.

data_description.state: The light is `on` if the template evaluates as `True`, `yes`, `on`, `enable` or a positive number. Any other value will render it as `off`.
data_description.turn_off: Defines actions to run when the light is turned off.
data_description.turn_on: Defines actions to run when the light is turned on.
data_description.level: Defines a template to get the brightness of the light. Valid values are 0 to 255.
data_description.set_level: Defines actions to run when the light is given a brightness command. The script will only be called if the `turn_on` call only has `brightness`, and optionally `transition`. Receives variables `brightness` and, optionally, `transition`.
data_description.hs: Defines a template to get the HS color of the light. Must render a tuple (hue, saturation).
data_description.set_hs: Defines actions to run when the light is given an HS color command. Available variables: `hs` as a tuple, `h` and `s`.
data_description.temperature: Defines a template to get the color temperature of the light.
data_description.set_temperature: Defines actions to run when the light is given a color temperature command. Receives variable `color_temp_kelvin`. May also receive variables `brightness` and/or `transition`.

data_description.state: Defines a template to set the state of the lock.  The lock is locked if the template evaluates to `True`, `true`, `on`, or `locked`.  The lock is unlocked if the template evaluates to `False`, `false`, `off`, or `unlocked`.  Other valid states are `jammed`, `opening`, `locking`, `open`, and `unlocking`.
data_description.lock: Defines actions to run when the lock is locked.
data_description.unlock: Defines actions to run when the lock is unlocked.
data_description.code_format: Defines a template to get the `code_format` attribute of the lock.
data_description.open: Defines actions to run when the lock is opened.

data_description.state: Template for the number's current value.
data_description.set_value: Defines actions to run when the number is set to a value. Receives variable `value`.
data_description.unit_of_measurement: Defines the unit of measurement of the number, if any.

data_description.state: Template for the select’s current value.
data_description.select_option: Defines actions to run when an `option` from the `options` list is selected. Receives variable `option`.
data_description.options: Template for the select’s available options.

data_description.state: Defines a template to get the state of the sensor. If the sensor is numeric, i.e. it has a `state_class` or a `unit_of_measurement`, the state template must render to a number or to `none`. The state template must not render to a string, including `unknown` or `unavailable`. An `availability` template may be defined to suppress rendering of the state template.
data_description.unit_of_measurement: Defines the unit of measurement for the sensor, if any. This will also display the value based on the number format setting in the user profile and influence the graphical presentation in the history visualization as a continuous value.

user.description: This helper allows you to create helper entities that define their state using a template. What kind of template would you like to create?
user.title: Template helper

data_description.value_template: Defines a template to set the state of the switch. If not defined, the switch will optimistically assume all commands are successful.
data_description.turn_off: Defines actions to run when the switch is turned off.
data_description.turn_on: Defines actions to run when the switch is turned on.

data_description.installed_version: Defines a template to get the installed version.
data_description.latest_version: Defines a template to get the latest version.
data_description.install: Defines actions to run when the update is installed. Receives variables `specific_version` and `backup` when enabled.
data_description.in_progress: Defines a template to get the in-progress state.
data_description.release_summary: Defines a template to get the release summary.
data_description.release_url: Defines a template to get the release URL.
data_description.title: Defines a template to get the update title.
data_description.backup: Enable or disable the `automatic backup before update` option in the update repair. When disabled, the `backup` variable will always provide `False` during the `install` action and it will not accept the `backup` option.
data_description.specific_version: Enable or disable using the `version` variable with the `install` action. When disabled, the `specific_version` variable will always provide `None` in the `install` actions
data_description.update_percentage: Defines a template to get the update completion percentage.

data_description.state: Defines a template to get the state of the vacuum. Valid values are `cleaning`, `docked`, `idle`, `paused`, `returning`, and `error`.
data_description.start: Defines actions to run when the vacuum is started.
data_description.fan_speed: Defines a template to get the fan speed of the vacuum.
data_description.fan_speeds: List of fan speeds supported by the vacuum.
data_description.set_fan_speed: Defines actions to run when the vacuum is given a command to set the fan speed. Receives variable `fan_speed`.
data_description.stop: Defines actions to run when the vacuum is stopped.
data_description.pause: Defines actions to run when the vacuum is paused.
data_description.return_to_base: Defines actions to run when the vacuum is given a 'Return to dock' command.
data_description.clean_spot: Defines actions to run when the vacuum is given a 'Clean spot' command.
data_description.locate: Defines actions to run when the vacuum is given a 'Locate' command.

deprecated_battery_level.title: Deprecated battery level option in {entity_name}
deprecated_battery_level.description:
The template vacuum options `battery_level` and `battery_level_template` are being removed in 2026.8.

Please remove the `battery_level` or `battery_level_template` option from the YAML configuration for {entity_id} ({entity_name}).

reload.name: [%key:common::action::reload%]
reload.description: Reloads template entities from the YAML-configuration.

code_format_template_error.message: Error evaluating code format template "{code_format_template}" for {entity_id}: {cause}
